snippet: Hassan Nasrallah, the leader of the militant group, was addressing tens of thousands of followers marking a major Shiite religious holiday.
abstract: Hassan Nasrallah, head of Hezbollah, Lebanese Shiite militant group whose armed followers are fighting in Syria on side of Pres Bashar al-Assad, pledges that his forces will remain there as long as necessary; makes announcement during address to tens of thousands of followers at ceremony marking major Shiite religious holiday.

byline.original: By ALAN COWELL and ANNE BARNARD
byline.contributor: Alan Cowell reported from London, and Anne Barnard from Beirut, Lebanon. Christine Hauser contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: Hassan Nasrallah, the leader of the militant group, was addressing tens of thousands of followers marking a major Shiite religious holiday.

headline.main: Hezbollah Chief Says His Forces Will Stay in Syria
headline.print_headline: Hezbollah Chief Says His Forces Will Stay in Syria

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
